wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Hardcastle (1752–1819) was an English merchant. One of the founders of the Missionary Society, later the London Missionary Society, he devoted time and money to its affairs, becoming its first treasurer.

response: * Joseph Hardcastle (1752–1819), one of the founders of the Missionary Society
*Joseph Reyner as treasurer, business partner of Joseph Hardcastle, Independent.
* Joseph Hardcastle (1752–1819), English merchant and a founder of The Missionary Society
* Joseph Hardcastle (politician), British Liberal Party MP
* Joseph Alfred Hardcastle, FRAS (1868–1917) - grandson of Joseph Hardcastle (politician) appointed Director of Armagh Observatory just before his death.

Burder was twice married: first, in 1810, to Ann, eldest daughter of Joseph Hardcastle of Hatcham House, New Cross, London, who died in 1827, leaving a daughter and three sons; and secondly, in 1833, to Mary, eldest daughter of the Rev. J. Tayler of Whitlinge, Worcestershire, who died in 1859 and is buried with her husband at Abney Park Cemetery.
